title: My plumber asked me 800rs for this saying its "Rare" [Help!]
selftext:
I have this [water filter](https://www.amazon.in/Eureka-Forbes-Aquaguard-Countertop-Installation/dp/B09NKS8Q2V/ref=sr_1_3?crid=25UGGF79HQ43N&keywords=marvel+nxt&qid=1685367236&sprefix=marvel+nx%2Caps%2C444&sr=8-3) and want to attatch its connection to the water pipe. which usually requires one of these [connection divertors](https://www.amazon.in/GE-Filtration-Coupling-Connector-Purifier/dp/B09MFRGKBN/ref=sr_1_9?crid=34CVVP88QVY3B&keywords=water+filter+valve&qid=1685367299&sprefix=water+filter+val%2Caps%2C342&sr=8-9). got a local plumber to do the installation and he quoted me 800rs for this piece of junk. i told him he can screw off and called aquagaurds installation team to do it. they did the installation, before installation they told me this valve would cost 200rs and after installation they said 600rs. cause its apparently rare and "branded and it is the heart of the system for the filter to function" dei adhu oru just a piece of plastic and gunk metal connector. its not like i was too broke to pay the amount , i just didn't want to give money to these scammers. The one they came with was an extremely brittle cheap plastic one aswell.

i tried getting this [filter valve](https://www.amazon.in/Stainless-Connector-Connection-Purifier-DV/dp/B09QSBVYNH/ref=sr_1_4?crid=2KFXWKX2MLIPN&keywords=water+filter+valve&qid=1685367537&sprefix=water+filter+valve%2Caps%2C293&sr=8-4) on amazon but the input pipe from the filter is too large for it .  
then tried getting [this one](https://www.amazon.in/gp/product/B09M7HH2RD/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o06_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1) but the pipe is too small for it  
Here is the image with the size of the input pipe from the filter : [https://imgur.com/a/3aIGscJ](https://imgur.com/a/3aIGscJ)

if anybody is familiar with the filter that i am using or this pipe size, please let me know what valve i should get for this.
comments: All water filter uses similar pipes. Check local Hardware stores. You will find it easily. Also buy sealing tape(yellow/white color) and a tool to screw this in the mainline. These things are easily done you just need to start.

I have changed them last month .

I took the connection from my existing tap, so the coupling should match with the tap
 and the other plastic connector is of standard size.

The metal coupling costs around Rs 70 in the local market, and the plastic connector around 150-200 (it was not available at the store I went to )
